channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024021778
item.description:
Report X-2024021778

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was punctured and a small amount of the product was on the outside of the box. The spill clearly came from one bottle, but the missing liquid is negligible. DescribePack: The hole in the side is about an inch by an inch, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a red hazmat tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought around 7:30 am to the damage cage for further inspection, because box was wet. DescribePack: The package box was wet because one of the caps was loose and the other content got soiled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a hazmat bag and tote and brought it to the damage cage.

item.title: Report E-2024020605
item.description:
Report E-2024020605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: MUNDS PARK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TITAN TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0825 ET Titan Transfer Inc. contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a 8 gallon release of UN1210-INK- PMC031 DK GRN SDA3C. It was reported the release was coming from a vehicle impacting concrete located on I-17 Munds Park AZ USA at the Christensen Rest Area (Southbound; Mile Marker #32). At 1248 EST, Graymar arrived on site and located the release. At 1320 EST, Graymar confirmed an estimated 8 gallons of PMC031D5 Dark Green SDA3C released. No drains or waterways were impacted. Newell Technologies, confirmed the product is flammable as a liquid, but once solidified, it is non-hazardous. GrayMar used absorbents, worked it into the impact, collected and placed into one 55-gal poly drum. The contractor will transport the one drum of spent absorbents to the contractor's shop. The impacted 15 gallon pail of product was placed into an overpack and placed onto the trailer as salvage material.

item.title: Report X-2024021138
item.description:
Report X-2024021138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX DISCOVERED ON DOCK BY MANAGER AND PLACED INTO HAZMAT BAG- COLLECTED BY QA FOR PROCESSING DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX IS STAINED FROM THE FLUID CONTAINED INSIDE THE PLASTIC BOTTLES WHICH HERE ALSO PLACED INSIDE DURABLE PLASTIC BAG AND SEALED SHUT.THE BOTTLES HAVE NO CRACKS OR LEAKS OR DENTS BUT THE FLUID HAS STAINED THE LABEL AND DAMAGED THE OUTER PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY THE BAG WAS IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO A HAZMAT BAG, AND ALL SURROUNDING SURFACES WERE WIPED DOWN
